issue.title: webloyalty ad on sncf-connect.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

ublock

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.sncf-connect.com/app/confirmation (after payment)

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard French filter, EasyList, Liste FR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. "webloyalty" ad shown in the payment confirmation page, known to be a scam presented in the form of an offer (https://www.journaldunet.com/ebusiness/commerce/1146478-webloyalty-bon-plan-pour-les-marchands-piege-pour-les-clients/)

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![Screenshot 2022-12-31 at 00-16-09 SNCF Connect - Confirmation du voyage](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/111613844/210117425-e47b7677-2c30-4d18-857f-24ef11ab0cd1.png)

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
>May I ask what is the use of DNS protection when I turn off the DNS filter?

When DNS protection is enabled and DNS filter is disabled, you can still set a different DNS server (some of DNS servers blocks ads, trackers, malware/phishing websites, some doesn't).
I have asked to disable DNS filter, just for test purpose, to know if issue is caused by blocked request(s) or maybe there is a different reason.

comment.body:
>I already wrote to you in my first message. (I can't get site data when I turn on DNS protection)When I turn off DNA protection, my problem is solved, I can get data from the site. But when I turn on DNS protection, I can't get data from the site.

`DNS protection` and `AdGuard DNS filter` are two different options, you can disable `AdGuard DNS filter` and still have `DNS protection` option enabled.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

It seems that it happens in Firefox only and website detects incognito/private mode.
I have added a rule which should fixes it (filters update should be available in 1-2 hours), but I think that it would be better if it would be fixed by a browser itself.

comment.body:
I tried many dns servers when DNS protection was enable, but all of them blocked data from the site. 
Continue receiving data from the site, First disable Adguard protection. 
Then I enable Adguard protection with DNS protection disable and the data from the site continues to be received.
As a result, DNS protection have to disable in order to receive data from the site. (Disable DNS filters is not enough)

Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

```adblock
kreiszeitung.de#%#(function(){var noopFunc=function(){};var tcData={eventStatus:"tcloaded",gdprApplies:!1,listenerId:noopFunc,vendor:{consents:{967:true}},purpose:{consents:[]}};window.__tcfapi=function(command,version,callback){"function"==typeof callback&&"removeEventListener"!==command&&callback(tcData,!0)}})();
```
also should works (without unblocking `cdn.opencmp.net`).

comment.body:
You may try this rule to access shadow-root (for products which support $replace), cannot test atm:

`cdn.opencmp.net/tcf-v2/platforms/modern/ui.js$replace=/mode\:\"closed\"/mode\:\"open\"/`

But for products without $replace function I do not see a way unless you rebuilt ui.js via javascript and delete site's elements.

Rules to unlock cookie dialogue (other two requests are only shown to me when first is unblocked):
```
@@||cdn.opencmp.net/*/cmp-stub-latest.js$domain=kreiszeitung.de
@@||cdn.opencmp.net/*/platforms^
@@||cdn.opencmp.net/publisher/dvl/
```

issue.title: eksisozluk.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.46.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://eksisozluk.com/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Turkish filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

**1. The color code of the autocomplete ad in the search box is incorrect.**

[https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/TurkishFilter/sections/css_extended.txt#L17](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/TurkishFilter/sections/css_extended.txt#L17)

The color code should be "0,0,0" instead of "0, 255, 255":
~~eksisozluk.com#?#.ui-autocomplete > li:has(> div[style="color:rgb(0, 255, 255)"])~~
eksisozluk.com#?#.ui-autocomplete > li:has(> div[style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0)"])


**2. Screenshots**
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>
eksisozluk.com#?#.ui-autocomplete > li:has(> div[style="color:rgb(0, 255, 255)"])

![Screenshot from 2022-12-31 13-54-25](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81188796/210134167-eedb2c98-24e4-48e7-a07a-c563a4aa2c3a.png)

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot 2:</summary>
eksisozluk.com#?#.ui-autocomplete > li:has(> div[style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0)"])

![b](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81188796/210134220-abb8d53c-0db9-4762-a9a6-69fdb5dd7794.png)

</details>

Tested with light and dark theme.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

ublock

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.sncf-connect.com/app/confirmation (after payment)

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard French filter, EasyList, Liste FR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. "webloyalty" ad shown in the payment confirmation page, known to be a scam presented in the form of an offer (https://www.journaldunet.com/ebusiness/commerce/1146478-webloyalty-bon-plan-pour-les-marchands-piege-pour-les-clients/)

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![Screenshot 2022-12-31 at 00-16-09 SNCF Connect - Confirmation du voyage](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/111613844/210117425-e47b7677-2c30-4d18-857f-24ef11ab0cd1.png)

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: eksisozluk.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.46.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://eksisozluk.com/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Turkish filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

**1. The color code of the autocomplete ad in the search box is incorrect.**

[https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/TurkishFilter/sections/css_extended.txt#L17](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/TurkishFilter/sections/css_extended.txt#L17)

The color code should be "0,0,0" instead of "0, 255, 255":
~~eksisozluk.com#?#.ui-autocomplete > li:has(> div[style="color:rgb(0, 255, 255)"])~~
eksisozluk.com#?#.ui-autocomplete > li:has(> div[style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0)"])


**2. Screenshots**
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>
eksisozluk.com#?#.ui-autocomplete > li:has(> div[style="color:rgb(0, 255, 255)"])

![Screenshot from 2022-12-31 13-54-25](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81188796/210134167-eedb2c98-24e4-48e7-a07a-c563a4aa2c3a.png)

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot 2:</summary>
eksisozluk.com#?#.ui-autocomplete > li:has(> div[style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0)"])

![b](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81188796/210134220-abb8d53c-0db9-4762-a9a6-69fdb5dd7794.png)

</details>

Tested with light and dark theme.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
It looks like that it depends on location - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/137961#issuecomment-1363957494 and I still cannot reproduce it (until I use VPN).
As I recall this website is often changing anti-adblock script (https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/search?q=dropgalaxy.com&type=issues) and it's probably checked on server side. Maybe it would be better to move it to AdGuard Extra repository?

comment.body:
@Jerry23011 Thanks. Please check the same, but add these rules

```adblock
@@||gm.mmstat.com
@@||fourier.taobao.com/rp?ext=
@@||log.mmstat.com^
@@||pcapp-data-collect.youku.com/pclog?cid=
@@wss://ws.mmstat.com/ws
```

Fixed in - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/15c081f0d8ca455a14800bf7e47ebdcbb24056b4
If I'm not wrong, placeholders in mobile view don't have `min-width`, but just `width`.

Okay, I will fix it.

```adblock
mirror.co.uk#%#//scriptlet("set-constant", "chameleonVideo.adDisabledRequested", "true")
```
will be enough (as I recall other websites used similar video player and rule like this was working correctly).

I found these two rules in base filter will cause this issue.

### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.drive2.ru](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.drive2.ru) ### Comment > Здравствуйте Уважаемая команда Adquard! > > Как же так получается, что я покупая Ваше дополнение вижу вот такие вот ярки рекламы. От которых это самое приложение должно защищать и блокировать их от глаз моих. > Возникает в таком случае а зачем оно вообще нужно и за почему я должен за него платить. > > Уважаемая команда Adquard прошу подобранных комментариев по этой ситуации. > > Что бы Вам было более понятно о чем я пишу во вложении прикладываю скриншоты.
